intro: Meibomia densiflora, commonly known as the dense-flowered meibomia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its dense clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom throughout the year. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a hairy texture. Meibomia densiflora is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks.
